TopicTitle: Which original 60's cosmonaut/astronaut is most similar mentally to Jeb

Articles.Content: Jeb is Kerbal badass there is no doubt of that, but to which astronaut or cosmonaut he's most similar.
I'd say none. I don't think there is a real astronaut with a "stupidity" as high as his.
Pete Conrad.
John Paul Stapp

John Paul Stapp

hahahahah this!

Pete Conrad.

Yeah he shouted "Whoopee" when jumped to the surface of the Moon lol.

And of course look at his face

looool

John Paul Stapp

and this!

Very kerbalish!

Neil Armstrong. Duh.

You could also count John Shepard, he was the one who got on an American rocket when he knew American rockets always blew up.

Well, courage and stupidity parameters aren't really an subject to judge yet, because are here, since first release of the game to govern kerbals emotions and would change when career mode get some shape.

From Apollo era astronauts I would choose (despite fact that astronaut are pretty tough in general) John Young and Neil Armstrong, because of their reputation of keeping their cool untouched in extreme situations... maybe they wasn't so crazy like Jeb ,but John Young blood pressure was nearly not changing during launches .

EDIT_1:

Pete Conrad.

I must admit, that this guy was certain winner when it comes to sense of humor... and was also very skilled astronaut.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SSN4MIsP_90

Won't really showing Pete, but it's giving pretty good picture

Edited August 2, 2013 by karolus10
Another vote for Pete Conrad. The mind games he played on the NASA shrinks alone are enough to push him well into Jeb territory.

Pete Conrad.

I agree:D.

I saw an episode of "From the Earth to the Moon" dedicated to the mission of Apollo 12, Pete Conrad reportedly was known for hot-blooded temperament and the fact that cursing like a sailor:-)

John Paul Stapp

by the way, reading about him made me search wikipedia to human subject experimentation, bringing me to nazi experiments, bringing me to the WWII Doctor Trials, which brought me to read about a certain famous british executioner Albert Pierrepoint who executed some of these doctors, which brought me to learn about two people he executed John Amery and William Joyce "Lord Haw Haw" which brought me to listen to some WWII radio propoganda, which brought me to watch some historical WWII videos, which brought me to find a show called "Crash Course History" on youtube, which brought me to watch shows about the Roman Empire, WWII, WWI, industrialization of the economy, and other such things. and now, I closed all those tabs after those few hours of learning, and to tell you thank you

yay learning
Yup, Pete Conrad, what a guy!
yep I got to agree with Pete Conrad though I think that Yuri Galagarin and Al Shepard are also kind of Jeb for strapping themselves to a rocket no one gone on before
I don't no who would be like Jeb but Gherman Titov is a lot like Bob. Being the first person to get sick in space.
Pete Conrad.
Capt. Kirk.

What about Jim Lovell?

That guy piloted Gemini's and Apollo's .Also he almost died in Apollo 13 ...

What about Jim Lovell?

That guy piloted Gemini's and Apollo's .Also he almost died in Apollo 13 ...

considering most of my craft have a major explosion and can still make it back, yea, he'll do.

You could also count John Shepard, he was the one who got on an American rocket when he knew American rockets always blew up.

I think you got him mixed up with Alan Glenn.

The thing what makes jeb is he knows hes safe because in his mind. Its at the front saying "WHOOO I'LL JUST BE REBUILT" While all the other astronauts have that back in there mind while in the front of theres is this, "OH GOD WERE GOING TO DIE"

That means, That jeb always knows that he won't die even if he feels pain.

While everyone else is just too worried on the ship heading towards the ground

Pete Conrad.

DEFINITELY Pete Conrad.

I think you got him mixed up with Alan Glenn.

This... this made me laugh haha well played!

Well given I have saluted the man in my signature since I started playing KSP and have considered him one of my personal heroes since the Gemini days, gotta go with Pete.

And if you haven't read his bio yet, Rocketman you are in for a treat. Here's the cover. Now tell me that ain't Jeb.
